headline: $615,000 a Day: Order to Keep Coal Plant Open Ignites Debate in Michigan
summary: Some consider the lakeside power station a dinosaur, while others are hoping to attract a data center.

headline: CMS Energy Announces Proposed Offering of $750 million of Convertible Senior Notes Due 2031
summary: CMS Energy Corporation ("CMS Energy") (NYSE: CMS) announced today that it intends to offer, subject to market and other conditions, $750 million aggregate principal amount of its convertible senior notes due 2031 (the "convertible notes") in a private placement under the Securities Act of 1933, as amended (the "Securities Act"). CMS Energy also intends to grant to the initial purchasers of the convertible notes an option to purchase, within a 13-day period from, and including, the date on which

headline: Is Rising Data Center Demand and Upgraded Guidance Shaping the CMS Energy (CMS) Investment Story?
summary: In late October 2025, CMS Energy reported third-quarter results showing increased sales and net income year over year, announced a quarterly dividend of US$0.5425 per share, and raised earnings guidance for both 2025 and 2026. The company attributed its positive outlook to higher electricity demand from AI-driven data centers, strong regulatory support for renewable investments, and substantial new infrastructure opportunities in Michigan. We'll explore how CMS Energy's upgraded guidance and...
